conclusion: Square wire frame with side length 0.2 m and total resistance 4 Ω is stationary on a horizontal surface.
Half of the frame is in a magnetic field pointing inward, varying with time as B = (3 + 2t) T.
Need to find the frictional force at t = 2.5 s.
Changing magnetic field induces an EMF and current in the wire frame.
Calculate magnetic flux: Area in field = 0.02 m², B at t = 2.5 s is 8 T, Flux Φ = 0.16 Wb.
Rate of change of magnetic flux dΦ/dt = 0.04 Wb/s.
Induced EMF = -0.04 V, Current I = 0.01 A.
Induced current flows clockwise to oppose increasing inward field.
Calculate magnetic force on segments: Force on CF and AD is 0.008 N each, opposite directions.
Net magnetic force is zero as forces on CF and AD cancel out.
Frictional force is zero since net magnetic force is zero.
Final answer: Frictional force magnitude is 0 N, direction not applicable.
